subject: Nutrition
title: How Food Studies Mislead
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How Food Studies Mislead.

hook.text: A 2015 study claimed chocolate aids weight loss. It was deliberately fakeâ€”designed to expose bad science.

buildup.text: Researcher John Bohannon ran a real trial with real people but used a tiny sample and many variables.

discovery.text: With only 15 subjects and 18 measurements, random chance guaranteed at least one significant finding.

twist.text: Major media outlets ran the story without questions. Millions believed chocolate was a diet food.

climax.text: Bohannon revealed the hoax to show how flawed nutrition science gets amplified by eager journalists.

quiz.question: Why did the fake chocolate study produce a 'significant' result?
options: Small sample size with many variables guaranteed a random hit
